categories.body: Episodes of Avatar: The Last Airbender

paragraphs.body: The opening card of each episode highlighted the show's logo.
paragraphs.text: The opening card of each episode highlighted the show's logo.

paragraphs.body: This is a list of episodes for the animated television series ${link_0}. The series premiered on February 21, 2005, and has aired through its third season, which ended on July 19, 2008. Notable merchandise based on the series include nine DVD sets of episodes, six-inch scale action figures, video games, stuffed animals distributed by Paramount Parks, and two Lego sets.
paragraphs.text: This is a list of episodes for the animated television series Avatar: The Last Airbender. The series premiered on February 21, 2005, and has aired through its third season, which ended on July 19, 2008. Notable merchandise based on the series include nine DVD sets of episodes, six-inch scale action figures, video games, stuffed animals distributed by Paramount Parks, and two Lego sets.

paragraphs.body: The series classifies each season as a "book" and each episode as a "chapter". The list is ordered by release date which, with the exception of "${link_0}", also adheres to the show's continuity.
paragraphs.text: The series classifies each season as a "book" and each episode as a "chapter". The list is ordered by release date which, with the exception of "Appa's Lost Days", also adheres to the show's continuity.

paragraphs.body: The release dates listed are from the U.S.A. airings.
paragraphs.text: The release dates listed are from the U.S.A. airings.

paragraphs.body: The first two chapters comprise the series premiere. The final two chapters comprise the season finale. The original pilot episode never aired, but can be seen on the sixth disc of The Complete Book 1 Collection.
paragraphs.text: The first two chapters comprise the series premiere. The final two chapters comprise the season finale. The original pilot episode never aired, but can be seen on the sixth disc of The Complete Book 1 Collection.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} and his sister ${link_1} (later renamed ${link_2}), must travel the world to find masters for ${link_3}, who is the ${link_4}. However, they must evade a critical foe, ${link_5} of the ${link_6}, who wants to capture Aang.
paragraphs.text: Sokka and his sister Kya (later renamed Katara), must travel the world to find masters for Aang, who is the Avatar. However, they must evade a critical foe, Prince Zuko of the Fire Nation, who wants to capture Aang.

paragraphs.body: The first chapter comprises the season premiere. The final two chapters comprise the season finale.
paragraphs.text: The first chapter comprises the season premiere. The final two chapters comprise the season finale.

paragraphs.body: A professor tells the gang about a ${link_0} full of information, hidden in the ${link_1}. Sokka decides to find the desert library in hopes of finding secrets and weaknesses about the Fire Nation. When the group arrives at the library, they find that much of the information on the Fire Nation has been destroyed; however, they still find crucial ${link_2} about firebenders that could possibly end the war.
paragraphs.text: A professor tells the gang about a Spirit Library full of information, hidden in the Si Wong Desert. Sokka decides to find the desert library in hopes of finding secrets and weaknesses about the Fire Nation. When the group arrives at the library, they find that much of the information on the Fire Nation has been destroyed; however, they still find crucial information about firebenders that could possibly end the war.

paragraphs.body: The first chapter comprises the season premiere. The final four chapters comprise the series finale.
paragraphs.text: The first chapter comprises the season premiere. The final four chapters comprise the series finale.

paragraphs.body: All three Books are available through the iTunes music store, BitTorrent, PlayStation Network, and Xbox Live Marketplace. These releases have the episodes "${link_0}" and "${link_1}" combined into one under the name of "The Secret of the Fire Nation", and the episodes "${link_2}" and "${link_3}" combined into "The Guru/The Crossroads of Destiny".
paragraphs.text: All three Books are available through the iTunes music store, BitTorrent, PlayStation Network, and Xbox Live Marketplace. These releases have the episodes "The Serpent's Pass" and "The Drill" combined into one under the name of "The Secret of the Fire Nation", and the episodes "The Guru" and "The Crossroads of Destiny" combined into "The Guru/The Crossroads of Destiny".
